Title: March 10, 2020 - Minimal March - Passing data between Blazor components and unit testing
Description:
Fritz continues working on the Blazor Components, using a Chromebook with vim and continuing to demonstrate active .NET development using just a command-line set of tools.  In this episode, he works on passing data and events between components.

21:08 - What are your views on vim vs VS Code at the moment?
29:29 - Have you tried the new xunit logger in the bunit?
35:22 - Shouldn't you use a service to pass data between view components?
47:20 - Why not keep the warnings and solve them eventually?
1:36:11 - Is there a good video or place to look to move your project to Devops for building and deploying?
1:41:11 - I don't know much about to integrate unit testing in .NET projects. What's the best place to getting started with it?
1:44:53 - So here's the real question: mstest or xunit?
2:23:47 - I have a project created in Razor. How difficult it would be to migrate it to Blazor if possible?


Source code at: https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents

Broadcasted live on Twitch -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz

The asynchronous nature of JavaScript to understanding the language. You'll find the use of callbacks, promises, and async/await in code that you write every day as a JavaScript developer. In this JavaScript tutorial, you'll learn about all three in about 10 minutes.

05:00 - Promises

Title: Modern Web Development with Blazor & .NET 5
Description: Blazor isn't just for new apps! Blazor in .NET 5 is integrated seamlessly with ASP.NET Core to enable modern full stack web development with .NET.
